definitions.definition: writing, music, art, speech, etc. that intentionally copies the style of someone famous or copies a particular situation, making the features or qualities of the original more noticeable in a way that is humorous:
examples: He was an 18th-century author who wrote parodies of other people's works.

definitions.definition: something that so obviously fails to achieve the effect that was intended that it is stupid:
examples: "It was a parody of a trial," said one observer.

definitions.definition: to copy the style of someone or something in a humorous way:
examples: One of the papers is running a competition in which you have to parody a well-known author.
